titlestmt.titleproper: Friedlander (Jonathan) collection of Middle Eastern Americana
Finding Aid for the Jonathan Friedlander Collection of Middle Eastern Americana LSC.1314
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lorraine Pratt, 2006, Sina Rahmadi, 2007, and Audra Eagle with assistance from Kelley Bachli, 2008 in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT); machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-19 10:16:07 -0700.

did.unittitle: Jonathan Friedlander collection of Middle Eastern Americana
did.abstract: Jonathan Friedlander, a scholar of Middle Eastern Studies and photographer of Americana began his personal collection of items documenting how Americans view the Middle East in 1971. The American Orientalism collection consists of photographic materials, pulp fiction, men's adventure magazines, comic books, audio and video recordings, advertisements, games, artifacts and objects, books, and sheet music.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access digital materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jonathan Friedlander collection of Middle Eastern Americana (Collection 1314). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Processed by Lorraine Pratt, 2006, Sina Rahmadi, 2007, and Audra Eagle with assistance from Kelley Bachli, 2008 in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT).

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Jonathan Friedlander, currently the assistant director of the UCLA Center for Near Eastern Studies, began to follow advertising and popular culture representations of the Middle East after moving to the United States in 1971. An Israel native, Friedlander started to collect a variety of popular culture publications and objects in earnest in the mid-1990s, in an effort to produce a collective representation of the way Americans view the Middle East.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes photographic materials, pulp fiction, men's adventure magazines, comic books, audio and video recordings, advertisements, games, artifacts and objects, books, and sheet music that document American Orientalism in popular culture. The collection includes visual and topical content that evokes "the Orient," political and historical relationships between the East and West, gender stereotypes of "Oriental" or "Arab" men and women, as well as American advertising presentations of "Oriental" items as those of luxury.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is arranged into ten series, five of which have been further arranged into subseries. Sound recordings, books, serials, sheet music, motion picture films, and Arabian Nights books are arranged alphabetically. The series and subseries arrangement is as follows:
Sound Recordings
Phonograph records
Compact discs
Books
[Books]
Children's books
Romance novels
Pocket-sized books
Serials
Pulp fiction
Comic books
Men's adventure magazines
Magazines
Advertisements
Games
Board games
Video games and manuals
Card games
Artifacts and Objects
Sheet Music
Motion Picture Films
Digital video discs (DVDs)
Laserdisks
VHS cassettes
Arabian Nights Books
Stereographs

altformavail.head: Online Items Available
altformavail.p: Portions of this collection have been digitized and are available online: Jonathan Friedlander Collection of Middle Eastern Americana (2669 items).

controlaccess.occupation: Middle East specialists -- California -- Los Angeles -- Archives.

did.unittitle: Sound Recordings
did.physdesc: 5 oversize boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of phonograph records (LPs) and compact discs (CDs) that document Middle Eastern artists or Orientalist perceptions of music and culture of the Middle East. The majority of the materials include sleeves and booklets of visual interest to the researcher interested in American Orientalism. The series includes belly dance music, classical interpretations of Scheherezade, motion picture soundtracks, and albums from popular musical performers.

did.unittitle: Phonograph records
did.physdesc: 5 oversize boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of LP records of multiple genres, including classical and popular music. Albums include music from Middle Eastern and American musicians, as well as dance compilations and soundtracks. Album sleeves are of great visual interest as the art and graphics displayed interpret the Middle East from a Western perspective.

did.unittitle: Golden voyage of Sinbad Los Angeles, CA: United Artists.
did.physdesc: 1 sound disc: analog, 33 1/3 rpm, stereo, 12 inches

list.item: Jacket excerpt reads, "The Golden Voyage of Sinbad provides the first completely new score by Miklós Rózsa in five years. Described by the composer himself as being in his 'finest oriental mood', it was recorded in the summer of 1973 in Rome, thereby taking Dr. Rózsa back to the scene of his former triumphs."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of compact discs (CDs), primarily popular music albums and compilations such as belly dance music.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access digital materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of serial publications ranging from pulp fiction, comic books, men's adventure magazines, and magazines. The illustrations and photography featured in these materials visibly document American Orientalism in popular culture, including erotic Orientalism and stereotypical representations of Middle Eastern people, history, and places.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series includes advertisements for multiple products and services that use Orientalist imagery. Products advertised include cigarettes, soap, rugs, fruit, and travel. The illustrations and photography featured in these materials visibly document American Orientalism in popular culture, including erotic Orientalism and stereotypical representations of Middle Eastern people, history, and places.

scopecontent.p: This series consists of board games, video games and manuals, and card games that include Orientalist imagery and objects. Many of the board and video games incorporate themes of war between the United States and countries in the Middle East.

did.unittitle: Castle Falkenstein: the Ottoman Empire Steve Jackson Games.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Creator: Masters, Phil.
Role: author.
Manual for role playing game giving players a historical and cultural overview of the Ottoman Empire. Book includes quotes from famous Orientalists such as Richard Burton.

did.unittitle: Conflict: Desert Storm, Gotham Games [PC]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On cover: "No Diplomats. No Negotiation. No Surrender." Players are to defeat Saddaam Hussein's army and expel the Iraq Army from Kuwait. Players can choose to join the U.S. Delta Force or the British SAS.

did.unittitle: Conflict: Desert Storm II, Back to Baghdad, Gotham games [PS2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Back cover reads: "From the smoke and fire of the Gulf War, four heroes return to finish the job they started."

list.item: Back cover reads: "In the heart of an enchanted city, a commoner named Aladdin and his mischievous monkey Abu battle to save the free-spirited Princess Jasmine from the schemes of the evil sorcerer Jafar. Aladdin's whole life changes with one rub of a magic lamp as a fun-loving, shape-shifting Genie appears and grants him three wishes, setting him on an incredible journey of discovery."

did.unittitle: Arabian nights Artisan Entertainment, 2000.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (179 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Based on the classic store "A Thousand and One Nights," this lavish production brings to life some of the most timeless fables to come down though the ages. A legendary heroine, Scheherazade, saves her kingdom and her own life by seducing her husband Schahriar's imagination with the fantastical tales of Aladdin, Ali Baba, other larger-than-life heroes, warriors, and djinns."

list.item: Back cover reads: "In the harsh desert of North Africa, Captain Michael Gallant of the Foreign Legion is stationed on a peacekeeping mission. While gangs and bandits disrupt local villages, Gallant commands a post of well-trained Legionnaires, leading them into battle and delivering justice wherever it is needed."

did.unittitle: Exodus Metro Goldwyn Mayer, 2002.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (198 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "[...the] chronicle of the rebirth of a people and the establishment of a nation is the ultimate experience in human drama...Ari Ben Canaan, a commander in the Israeli underground, manages to lead 600 Jews from the detention camps in Cyprus onto a large freighter bound for Palestine. But British forces soon learn of his plan and insist that he turn back. Undaunted, Ari and his passengers refuse to give up, risking their lives for the greater cause of Israeli independence." Based on Leon Uris book.

did.unittitle: House of sand and fog Dreamworks Pictures.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (126 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: "Academy Award winner Ben Kingsley and Jennifer Connelly deliver stunning performances as two strangers whose conflicting pursuits of the American Dream lead to a fight for their hopes at any cost. What begins as a struggle over a rundown bungalow spirals into a clash that propels everyone involved toward a shocking resolution."

did.unittitle: Intolerance Alpha Video, 2003.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (197 minutes): no sound, black & white, 4 3/4 inches

did.unittitle: Khartoum Metro Goldwyn Mayer, 2002.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (136 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "In 1883, British Prime Minister Gladstore dispatches General Charles Gordon to Khartoum, Sudan, where thousands of civilians are threatened by a Muslim fanatic, the Mahdi, and his army of followers. Gordon gains the Mahdi's respect but can't prevent the Mahdi's men from laying siege to the city. Now, as history hangs in the balance, Gordon faces the fight of his life defending the ancient city of Khartoum."

did.unittitle: Lawrence of Arabia Columbia Pictures, 2000.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (217 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (217 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Insert includes text from original promotional materials.

did.unittitle: Lion man Alpha Video , 2004.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (60 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "A wealthy explorer, Sir Ronald Chatham, accompanied by his young son, embarks on a dangerous scientific mission to search for valuable deposits of tungsten in the Arabian Desert. Crossing the desert sands on camelback, Sir Ronald's party is massacred by a tribe of evil Arabics and only the youngster survives–rescued by a mysterious white woman. Injured herself and near death, she leaves him in the care of a wizened desert mystic who lives peacefully alongside the lions. The old man takes the child in and raises him to manhood. Years later the handsome young man, now revered as "El Lion" by the Arabs, learns about the fate of his father and sets out to avenge his murder."

did.unittitle: Mummy Universal Studio, 1999.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (74 minutes): sound, black & white, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Boris Karloff's legendary performance has become a landmark in the annals of screen history. As the mummy, Im-Ho-Tep, he is accidently revived after 3700 years by a team of British archaeologists. It is revealed in a flashback that he was a high priest, embalmed alive for trying to revive the vestal virgin whom he loved, after she had been sacrificed. Alive again, he sets out to find his lost love."

did.unittitle: Mummy Universal Studios.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (125 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Deep in the Egyptian desert, a handful of people searching for a long-lost treasure have just unearthed a 3000 year old legacy of terror." Cover features three pyramids.

did.unittitle: Mummy's shroud The Hammer Bay Collection, 1995.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (90 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Beware the beat of the cloth-wrapped feet!"

did.unittitle: Not without my daughter Metro Goldwyn Mayer, 2001.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (116 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover: "Betty has come to the Middle East with her daughter and native- born husband for a visit with his family. But soon the horrible truth about their 'vacation' surfaces. Betty's husband doesn't intend to bring his family back to America...ever. She may return, he says, but their daughter must stay. And he has centuries of local custom and the oppressive might of a police state behind him..."

did.unittitle: Order Columbia Tristar Pictures.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (89 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Journey to a turbulent world under siege as reformed artifact smuggler Rudy travels to Jerusalem to rescue his musuem-curator father, who's been kidnapped by ruthless fanatics, and recover a sacred scroll believed to hold dangerous secrets of a underground sect. Framed for murder by a scheming police chief, Rudy enlists the aid a mysterious beauty to clear his name and wages a one-man battle to recapture the prized manuscript before the ultimate Holy War breaks out and all hell breaks loose."

did.unittitle: Passion of the Christ 20th Century Fox.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (126 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

did.unittitle: Road to Morocco Universal Studios, 2002.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (83 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Survivors of a Mediterranean shipwreck, stowaways Jeff and Orville paddle to a North African shore and hitch a camel ride across the desert to Morocco. In order to buy food, Jeff sells Orville into slavery–but Orville's owner turns out to be the luscious Princess Shalmar, who quickly offers to become his wife." B&W 93 Mins

did.unittitle: Rules of engagement Paramount Pictures.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (127 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Colonel Terry Childers is a patriot and war hero. But when a peacekeeping mission he leads in Yemen goes terribly wrong, he finds himself facing a court martial. Accused of breaking the rules of engagement by killing unarmed civilians, Childers' only hope of vindication rests with comrade-in-arms Hays Hodges, a military lawyer of questionable abilities. Together, they face the battle of their lives."

did.unittitle: Sheik and The son of the sheik Artcinema Corporation, 2002.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (155 minutes): no sound, black & white, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Includes additional footage pertaining to the making of the film and newsreels from the film's release.

did.unittitle: Siege 20th Century Fox.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (116 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "When a crowded city bus blows up in Brooklyn and a campaign of terror begins to make its bloody mark on the streets of New york, it's up to FBI special agent Anthony Hubbard and U.S. Army General William Devereaux to find out who's responsible...and put an end to the destruction. Together, they face explosive danger at every turn when they team up to wage an all-out war against a ruthless band of terrorists."

did.unittitle: Stargate Artisan Entertainment, 2003.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (119 minutes): sound, black & white, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "When Professor Daniel Jackson innocently accepts the offer of a mysterious woman to decode an ancient Egyptian artifact known only as the Stargate, he unwittingly takes the first step on an epic adventure that will span galaxies and decide the fate of an entire planet."

did.unittitle: Thief of Baghdad: an Arabian nights fantasy United Artists , 2004.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (154 minutes): no sound, color tinted, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "...The Thief of Baghdad is a bold Arabian adventure starring Douglas Fairbanks as a carefree pickpocket who turns his appealing brand of mischievous thievery toward the attainment of happiness...and an exotic Princess. The only way he can win either is by retrieving the rarest treasures hidden within the mysterious Orient, a quest that grows more fantastic with every passing thrill, as the tenacious thief rises high above the city on a magic carpet, battles a fire-breathing dragon in caverns of flame and soars into the clouds on the back of a winged steed via innovative special effects."

did.unittitle: Three kings Warner Brothers Pictures.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (115 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "Three Kings begins when the Gulf War is over. Amid the partying and the confusion, four American soldiers, determined to take home more than sand fleas, go off into the Iraqi desert to find millions in stolen Kuwait bullion. They are plunged into the heart of a democratic uprising that spins the day and their lives out of control."

list.item: Back cover reads "...Tom Wayne is a fugitive from justice, framed for a murder he did not commit. El Shaitan, the mysterious and diabolical leader of the Devil's Circle, a group who are plotting an Arab rebellion against the Foreign Legion, is to blame..."

did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (119 minutes): sound, color, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "In 1904 Morocco, European powers desire a foothold in the Arab world–and [Arab desert chieftan] Raisuli is determined to stir up tribal fury against them. So he kidnaps an American widow and her children, igniting a chain of events that include President Theodore Roosevelt wielding the big stick of foreign policy and Raisuli matching wits and sharing mutual admiration with his lovely captive."

did.unittitle: Yank in Libya Producers Releasing Corporation, 2004.
did.physdesc: 1 videodisc (66 minutes): sound, black & white, 4 3/4 inches

list.item: Back cover reads: "While traveling through the deserts of Libya, Mike Malone, a brash and cocky newspaper reporter, uncovers a Nazi plot to incite Arab tribes to arise and murder all Americans. When he tries to report the imminent danger to the British consul, no one wants to listen. He decides to investigate on his own."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of collected translations of and critical theory about the popular Arabian Nights stories, also known as One Thousand and One Nights, The Arabian Nights Entertainment, and Tales from the Arabian Nights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of mounted stereographic prints and photographs documenting the people and places of the Middle East, including Egypt, Palestine, Algeria, and Turkey, as well as comical depictions of harems. Many of the items in this subseries include descriptive and explanatory notes on verso of cards.
